meanings.definition: A school or institution offering instruction in many technical arts and applied sciences.
meanings.sent1: The local polytechnic provides hands-on training in various technical fields.
meanings.sent2: I am considering enrolling in a polytechnic to learn about engineering and computer science.
meanings.sent3: The polytechnic decided to host a science fair to showcase student projects.
meanings.sent4: Her mind was a polytechnic of knowledge, with each subject neatly organized like different departments.
meanings.sent5: Walking through the bustling halls of the polytechnic, I could feel the excitement of learning in the air.

meanings.definition: Relating to or characteristic of a polytechnic.
meanings.sent1: The polytechnic curriculum emphasizes practical skills over theoretical knowledge.
meanings.sent2: She admired the polytechnic approach to education, focusing on real-world applications.
meanings.sent3: His attempt at a polytechnic hairstyle ended up looking more like a messy experiment.
meanings.sent4: The city had a polytechnic vibe, with innovation and creativity at every corner.
meanings.sent5: The polytechnic mindset values innovation and problem-solving in all aspects of life.
